content:
TITLE: Installing Restate SDK for Python
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install the Restate SDK using pip. It requires Python >= v3.11 as a prerequisite.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pip install restate_sdk
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Listing Python Package Dependencies for Restate SDK
DESCRIPTION: A requirements file listing the necessary Python packages for running Restate SDK applications. It includes hypercorn for serving the application and the restate_sdk package itself.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/test-services/requirements.txt#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: plaintext
CODE:
```
hypercorn
restate_sdk
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Setting up Virtual Environment for Local Development
DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to set up a virtual environment using VirtualEnv for local development of the Restate Python SDK.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
python3 -m venv .venv
source .venv/bin/activate
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing Build Tools for Restate SDK Development
DESCRIPTION: This code installs the necessary build tools for developing the Restate Python SDK using the requirements.txt file.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Releasing Restate SDK Package
DESCRIPTION: This set of commands demonstrates the process of releasing a new version of the Restate Python SDK, including updating the version, committing changes, and pushing a new tag.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
git checkout main && git pull
git tag -m "Release v0.1.0" v0.1.0
git push origin v0.1.0
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Docker Image for Test Services
DESCRIPTION: Command to build a Docker image for test services using the provided Dockerfile.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/test-services/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
docker build . -f test-services/Dockerfile -t restatedev/test-services
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Building Rust Module for Restate SDK
DESCRIPTION: This command builds the Rust module and includes opt-in additional dev dependencies for the Restate Python SDK development.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
maturin dev -E test,lint
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running Verification for Restate SDK
DESCRIPTION: This command runs linting and testing for the Restate Python SDK using the 'just' command runner.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
just verify
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Running SDK Test Suite
DESCRIPTION: Command to run the Restate SDK test suite with Java. This requires JVM 17 or higher and uses an exclusions file to filter tests.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/test-services/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
java -jar restate-sdk-test-suite.jar run --exclusions-file test-services/exclusions.yaml restatedev/test-services
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Debugging Single Test Case
DESCRIPTION: Command to debug a specific test case in the Restate SDK test suite. This example runs a test from the lazyState test suite.
SOURCE: https://github.com/restatedev/sdk-python/blob/main/test-services/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: shell
CODE:
```
java -jar restate-sdk-test-suite.jar debug --test-suite=lazyState --test-name=dev.restate.sdktesting.tests.State default-service=9080
```
